no.hist.aitel.team12.database

Interface Database

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DatabaseConnection

    public interface Database
    This interface specifies all relevant methods to be used against the database, to allow for easy swapping of database systems.
    Some coupling has been allowed between the application layer and the database layer through this interface in order to make code shorter and more readable
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Hallgeir

    • Method Detail

      • executeQuery

        java.lang.String[][] executeQuery(java.lang.String sql)
        This is a general purpose sql query, only to be used from the SqlTab by the system administrator
        Parameters:
        sql - The statement to be run.
        Returns:
        The result of the query.

      • executeUpdate

        java.lang.String executeUpdate(java.lang.String sql)
        This is a general purpose sql update, only to be used from the SqlTab by the system administrator
        Parameters:
        sql - The statement to be run.
        Returns:
        The result. Can be error, or lines affected

      • executePreparedStatement

        boolean executePreparedStatement(java.lang.String statement,
                                 java.lang.Object... args)
        Executes the given prepared statement with the provided arguments
        Parameters:
        statement - A string with a syntacticly correct SQL statement
        args - A list of arguments, in the correct order.
        Returns:
        True if the update was successful, false if not.

      • getUserID

        int getUserID(java.lang.String username)
        Method for retrieving the user ID through the username. Although the usernames are unique, comparisons between ints are more reliable than Strings, and therefore using the user IDs should be preferred over using the user name in the application logic.
        Parameters:
        username - The username
        Returns:
        The unique ID for this user

      • getUsername

        java.lang.String getUsername(int userID)
        Method for retrieving the username through the userID. Using ints for comparisons are more reliable than Strings.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user
        Returns:
        The username corresponding to the ID

      • isUserInDb

        boolean isUserInDb(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if a username is currently in the db
        Parameters:
        username - The username to check
        Returns:

      • getPersons

        Person[] getPersons(int userID)
        Retrieves an array of all persons in the db. Note that the objects in this array is never simply of the base type Person, but either User or Personnel
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user the returned users are related to. This must be either the system admin (return all users) or a centre manager
        Returns:
        An array of needed users

      • getPasswordHash

        java.lang.String getPasswordHash(int user)
        Finds the hashed and salted password for the user indicated by the user ID. Use the PasswordManager class to validate passwords.
        Parameters:
        user - The ID of the user
        Returns:
        The hashed and salted password
        See Also:
        PasswordManager

      • testConnection

        boolean testConnection()
        This method test the database connection by retrieving the table names, thus validating that we can execute queries.
        Returns:
        True if the query is successful, False if not

      • teardown

        void teardown()
        This method cleans up the database connection, closing it.
        It needs to be called before the application is shut down.

      • getShoppingCentres

        ShoppingCentre[] getShoppingCentres(int userID)
        Finds all shopping centres in the database related to the user in question. For the SysAdmin (UserID = 1) this means every shopping centre. These shopping centre objects is fully set up with buildings and establishments
        Parameters:
        userID - The user ID of the user
        Returns:
        The related shopping centres

      • getEstablishmentsInBuilding

        Establishment[] getEstablishmentsInBuilding(int buildingID)
        Retrieves all establishment in a certain building
        Parameters:
        buildingID - The ID of the building in question
        Returns:
        The array

      • getUserType

        UserType getUserType(int userId)
        Finds the UserType of the user.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user in question
        Returns:
        The type of the user

      • getCentreID

        int getCentreID(int userID)
        Retrieves the corresponding centre ID to a user
        Parameters:
        userID - The user ID
        Returns:
        The centreID related to a user. 0 in the case of the system admin, -1 if invalid user

      • getEstablishmentID

        int getEstablishmentID(int userID)
        Retrieves the establishment ID for a shop owner. Returns -1 if an invalid user ID is supplied.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of a shop owner
        Returns:
        The establishment ID

      • getMessages

        Message[] getMessages(java.lang.String username)
        Parameters:
        username - The user in question
        Returns:
        A list of all messages, sent and recieved
